message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were a primary or secondary school teacher from Brazil. I need to provide responses to all 10 statements.

Let me think about reasonable responses for each statement from a teacher's perspective in Brazil:

TT4G35A - "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans."
This is a positive use case. Most teachers would likely agree this is true. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35B - "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities."
This is also a positive capability of AI. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35C - "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually."
Positive use case. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35D - "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs)."
This is a positive and important capability. I'll say "Strongly agree"

TT4G35E - "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks."
This is well-established. I'll say "Strongly agree" - this is something many teachers would really appreciate

TT4G35F - "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own."
This is a negative aspect. Teachers would likely agree this is a concern. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35G - "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct."
This is a valid concern. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35H - "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions."
This is a known concern. I'll say "Agree"

TT4G35I - "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data."
This is a significant concern. I'll say "Strongly agree"

TT4G35J - "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students."


This is plausible and represents a real risk. I'll say "Agree"

Now I'll structure these responses for the function call.
